tasks.task: Visit a organic farm and observational learning
subtasks: Observe the layout and structure of an organic farm.
Note the use of chicken coop and manure collection system.
Observe the diversity of crops planted in small plots.
Understand the benefits of rotating crops and using different plant families.
Learn about pest control methods, including physical barriers and beneficial insects.
Observe the use of drip irrigation systems for efficient water usage.
Understand the process of direct seeding and cultivation.
Learn about the double digging technique to prepare seedbeds minimally.
Reflect on importance of biodiversity and small-scale farming in organic agriculture.
